0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: {unique-task-statement-1}: Verifies shipments against customs documentation to ensure accuracy and completeness.
{unique-task-statement-2}: Coordinates with exporters and importers to resolve discrepancies or issues related to customs clearance.
{unique-task-statement-3}: Obtains necessary permits and licenses for the importation of goods, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
{unique-task-statement-4}: Conducts research on changes in trade regulations and tariffs to ensure clients are aware of any updates that may affect their shipments.
{unique-task-statement-5}: Prepares and submits Harmonized System (HS) codes for accurate categorization and classification of goods.
{unique-task-statement-6}: Examines shipment documentation, including commercial invoices, bills of lading, and certificates of origin, to verify authenticity and accuracy.
{unique-task-statement-7}: Maintains accurate records of customs shipments, including documentation, delivery times, and any issues encountered during clearance.
{unique-task-statement-8}: Facilitates communication between clients, carriers, and government agencies to resolve discrepancies or facilitate the clearing process.
{unique-task-statement-9}: Analyzes data from customs transactions to identify trends and potential areas for cost savings or efficiency improvements.
{unique-task-statement-10}: Ensures compliance with all applicable regulations, including laws and international agreements related to customs brokerage.
{unique-task-statement-11}: Provides clients with regular updates on the status of their shipments, ensuring transparency and minimizing delays.
{unique-task-statement-12}: Manages relationships with carriers, freight forwarders, and other industry professionals to secure competitive rates and services.
{unique-task-statement-13}: Obtains necessary licenses and certifications required by customs brokerage laws and regulations.
{unique-task-statement-14}: Conducts on-site inspections of warehouses or storage facilities to ensure compliance with customs regulations.
{unique-task-statement-15}: Negotiates with carriers and freight forwarders to secure the best possible rates for clients' shipments.
{unique-task-statement-16}: Manages a client's supply chain, including transportation, storage, and delivery options.
{unique-task-statement-17}: Maintains knowledge of applicable customs regulations, laws, and agreements, staying up-to-date on any changes or updates.
{unique-task-statement-18}: Provides training to new staff members or clients on customs procedures, regulations, and best practices.
{unique-task-statement-19}: Develops and implements processes to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and increase client satisfaction.
{unique-task-statement-20}: Assists with the resolution of disputes or claims related to customs shipments, working closely with carriers and government agencies as needed.

{unique-task-statement-21}: Creates and maintains a comprehensive understanding of clients' business operations and supply chain requirements, using this knowledge to provide expert advice and guidance.
1: Conduct needs assessments to identify training gaps for employees.
Develop, implement, and evaluate employee training programs.
Create learning materials, including instructional guides, manuals, and presentations.
Design and deliver leadership development workshops.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to create customized training content.
Establish and maintain partnerships with external training providers.
Coordinate logistics for corporate events, conferences, and training sessions.
Develop strategies to improve employee engagement and motivation through training initiatives.
Foster a culture of continuous learning within the organization.
Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs and make recommendations for improvement.
Create a centralized database to track employee training records and progress.
2: Prepare menu items according to dietary restrictions and food allergies
Maintain a clean and organized kitchen environment to prevent contamination
Operate cooking equipment such as stoves, ovens, and grills with attention to safety protocols
Order and manage inventory of ingredients and supplies
Develop and implement menus that meet nutritional standards and guest preferences
Monitor food temperature and handling procedures to ensure food safety
Prepares ingredients for meal preparation by washing, chopping, dicing, etc.
Maintain accurate records of food inventory, orders, and waste disposal
Prepare special dietary meals such as vegan, gluten-free, or low-carb according to patient requirements
Ensure adherence to proper food handling and sanitation procedures
Plan menus for events and functions, including weddings, corporate meetings, etc.
Replenish supplies of equipment, utensils, and other necessary materials
